page.title: 12THE GOTHIC STYLE
page.content: The Gothic style houses in Marford first appeared in the early 1800's. Features included rusticated trellis work at their entrances and also blocked up windows to avoid taxes.On all of the houses the window and door heads are arched over with what is known as the "ogee curve." Another feature of the houses were the plain crosses left in the brickwork or stone. These can be explained by local superstition. A tradgedy occurred when one of the villagers died in dubious conditions. The death put numerous villagers in fright. All the houses were covered with crosses to keep away the ghost of the dead woman, which several villagers claimed to have seen.
